Solomon Kane.Action: Commands to show no mercy to the heathens and kills without hesitation.
Leads men into combat confidently and skillfully.
Shoots his own man in the back for fleeing, calling him a 'faithless coward'.
Commands men to push forward relentlessly despite chaos and fear around.
Delegates the care of prisoners to Lieutenant Malthus rather than addressing directly.
Shows no empathy toward frightened civilians (women and children screaming), continues destruction.
Laughs while dismissing Malthus's moral objections and mocks his lack of ambition.
Orders half the men to accompany Malthus despite their disagreement and ongoing hostile situation.
Leads an aggressive assault through the castle, showing ruthless and focused behavior.
Shoots a man who provides directions, kills every last defender and survivor without mercy.
Snarls and grabs a soldier to command him aggressively.
Encourages men to advance into unknown danger with eagerness and confidence.
Unafraid, methodically searches throne room despite eerie atmosphere.
Commands soldiers firmly and confidently under pressure.
Advances eagerly and unafraid into an unknown and dangerous throne room, prepared with weapons.
Attempts to force open the heavy doors to rescue companions but fails as doors have no handles.
Remains calm and observant upon encountering eerie and hostile supernatural phenomena in the throne room.
Moves slowly and cautiously when uncertain, indicating awareness of potential danger rather than reckless behavior.
Holds his ground and refuses to show fear despite the menacing, corrupt Reaper confronting him.
Insists he has no master save the Queen, rejecting the devil's claim on him.
Mentions he is a soldier who killed only in his duties, implicitly justifying his actions.
Holds his ground initially against a powerful, supernatural adversary showing confidence.
Claims no fear of the Devil’s Reaper and sorcerers despite evident growing nervousness.
Struggles to resist the Reaper's power but is repeatedly knocked down and physically overwhelmed.
Attempts to deny the Reaper's claims and assert his identity and loyalties despite overwhelming opposition.
Refuses to bow to the Reaper and gives a defiant stand against evil despite fear and being overwhelmed.
Refuses to give himself to the Devil despite torment, symbolizing steadfastness and integrity.
Endures suffering in isolation at the monastery for nearly a year without complaint or reaching out.
His screams in the night suggest inner turmoil but no indication of seeking comfort or connection from others.
Charges at the huge stained glass window and smashes through it to escape or confront his enemy, displaying decisiveness and boldness.
Plummets down into the void, seemingly falling uncontrollably, which may indicate a moment of vulnerability or lack of control.
Endures torment and refuses to give in to the Devil's demands, showing inner strength and mental resilience.
Is kept in sanctuary by monks for nearly a year, screaming in the night due to past trauma, which suggests a weakened or broken state.
Responds politely to the monks who visit him with calm, respectful greeting despite his evident suffering.
Remains silent but watchful, shows no immediate friendliness or openness to visitors, retains distance.
Acknowledges the novice’s staring without anger or harshness, explains his marked state matter-of-factly.
Does not initiate conversation or display warmth beyond necessary civility, projects a haunted, withdrawn demeanor.
Remains silent but watchful when monks enter his cell, showing self-control and awareness.
Engages in polite and measured conversation despite his harsh circumstances.
Shows physical signs of having endured great ordeals (marked body with runes and scars) yet persists, indicating resilience and fortitude.
Displays humility and diffidence, having moved away from brash aggression to a quieter demeanor.
Does not immediately explain or defend his marked body or status, possibly avoiding confrontation or unnecessary explanation.
The text does not show Kane initiating any decisive action in this excerpt, being mostly reactive and silent.
Apologizes to the Abbot for disturbing prayers, shares his haunted dreams honestly.
Closes the lid of his chest after gathering his forbidden books, showing respect for the Abbot's concerns.
Insists that the dark books are just books, showing a dismissive attitude toward the Abbot's beliefs.
Expresses feelings of being damned and doubts about redemption, revealing vulnerability and sincerity.
Calmly gathers and secures his forbidden books and papers when confronted by the Abbot, showing awareness of risk and cautious discretion.
Speaks honestly yet evasively about his situation, showing self-awareness but also a subtle attempt to mask full truth to avoid suspicion.
Continues to involve himself with dark and forbidden texts despite the clear danger and the Abbot’s warnings.
Shows internal conflict and uncertainty about his own redemption and place, indicating some lack of confidence or clarity in his own purpose.
Pleads with the Abbot to remain in the sanctuary and expresses reluctance to leave.
Accepts food from the monks silently and departs alone into the unknown despite the hardship.
Refuses to return home or abandon his path despite pressure, showing sincerity and resolve.
Refuses to leave the monastery despite the Abbot's insistence, showing strong will but no immediate solution.
Accepts exile and leaves the monastery with minimal possessions and a staff, prepared to face the unknown instead of resisting further.
Sets out alone into the wilderness after monastery expulsion, demonstrating readiness to face hardship and uncertainty.
Steps out of the way to allow a family wagon to pass safely.
Declines offer of a ride, thanking the driver politely but insists on continuing alone.
Keeps focus and presses on despite disturbing sight of corpses, showing no visible reaction or empathy at the scene.
Keeps calm and does not fight when threatened and abused by thieves, resists intimidation but avoids escalation.
Keeps his head down and tries to avoid trouble despite being attacked and robbed.
Keeps his head down when threatened and surrenders belongings without escalating the situation.
Does not physically fight back immediately when threatened or attacked, showing patience and self-control.
Yanks head free at the right moment and stares down his attacker, causing the attacker to flinch.
Fails to prevent being overpowered and robbed by multiple dangerous assailants.
Refuses to kill or fight, renounces violence despite provocation and physical assault.
Defies his father's harsh demands and refuses to comply with an unwanted life path.
Refuses to fight the thieves despite being provoked and struck, clearly stating he has renounced violence.
Maintains a deadly stare that causes a thief to flinch, showing confidence and control without physical confrontation.
Defies his father’s authority firmly and declares his own desires and beliefs at age fourteen.
Storms out after rejecting his father’s demands, choosing own path despite consequences.
Does not physically resist or fight back when attacked by Beard with a wooden cudgel, appearing passive in the situation.
Draws a knife and rushes to stop a powerful young man from assaulting a girl.
Halts, stunned, upon recognizing the attacker as his brother Marcus.
Shows concern for Sarah, asks if she is hurt and commands her to run away from danger.
Intervenes to protect Sarah from Marcus’s abuse despite threat to himself.
Attempts to teach his brother humility rather than resorting immediately to violence.
In anger, shoves his brother who subsequently falls off cliff but desperately tries to save him.
Watches silently as a boy works nearby, does not threaten or startle him despite his weakened state.
Faints or shows weakness and pain without lashing out or showing hostility.
Asks gently who is caring for him, shows openness to others despite his suspicious state.
Tries to right himself despite lack of energy and pain.
Wakes slowly and weakly, groans in pain, shows initial physical vulnerability.
Acknowledges safely being taken and shows cautious trust towards William.
Reflects silently and does not reject the help or offer from William despite initial pride.
Does not display hostility or distrust despite being wounded and weak.
Despite being wounded and weak, Kane tries to rise and continues fighting.
Studies William carefully before engaging, showing caution and awareness.
Regrets not accepting offered help earlier, indicating awareness of his own limits.
Steps out of the wagon unsteadily, indicating lingering weakness but perseverance.
Insists on not being idle and offers to help after receiving hospitality.
Reassures Samuel by telling him not to fear and asks his name gently.
Shares personal and painful scars openly to Meredith, inviting her closer and explaining their meaning.
Insists on helping despite being injured and unsteady.
Reassures Samuel gently to gain his trust.
Shows his tattoos and scars openly as a way to communicate his history and strength.
Does not respond immediately to Samuel’s silence, instead patiently repeats the question.
Joins the family in a shared prayer moment, respectfully listens to others praying.
Expresses gratitude to Mistress Crowthorn for the meal.
Answers questions about his violent past carefully without boasting or belittling others' views.
Swears an oath never to harm another man and refuses to fight even when confronted by robbers.
Offers to take over watch so that William can rest.
Sits quietly with William by the fire, sharing a peaceful moment.
Appears silently from the shadows and fumbles ineffectually for a cudgel when challenged.
Honestly admits his violent past and warns he may bring danger, showing openness and sincerity.
Expresses understanding if he is no longer welcome, respecting others' boundaries.
Accepts clothing gift with gratitude and says he will wear them with pride, showing appreciation and warmth.
Encourages Samuel to listen to his elder brother, nodding approvingly at the boy.
Shares a quick smile with Meredith, who giggles in response.
Responds courteously to Edward's reprimand about Puritan clothing, showing respect.
Quietly admits to Samuel his violent past and the need to undo his old life.
Stops Samuel from misusing a stick and gaining the respect of the boy by calmly asserting authority.
Accepts and models Puritan clothing, showing adaptability and social awareness.
Acknowledges Edward’s serious perspective on faith despite sharing a lighter moment with Meredith, showing emotional intelligence.
Tells Samuel he needs to undo his old life rather than start anew in America, indicating self-awareness and a thoughtful approach to his past and future.
Reflects quietly on his former violent capabilities, suggesting control over his past impulses.
Joins the playful spirit by jokingly parrying Samuel's thrust with a stick, making Meredith laugh and Edward smile.
States he has no cause to fight Samuel despite provocation.
Previously states he would have cut out hearts, showing past violence and ruthlessness.
Joins in playful sparring with Samuel, parrying with a stick confidently and humorously.
Observes the destroyed village and corpses carefully, showing attentiveness and serious assessment of the situation.
Refuses to fight Samuel without cause, demonstrating restraint and controlled judgment.
Tells others to keep back from a dangerous scene, maintaining control and caution.
Acknowledges the hopelessness of the victims and insists they must leave as nothing can be done.
Engages in the burial of the dead alongside others despite physical discomfort and exhaustion.
Expresses gratitude to Meredith for caring for his wounds.
Immediately identifies that the threat is a witch and not the Devil, demonstrating awareness and insight.
Assesses the situation realistically and insists they must leave because there is nothing more they can do for the victims.
Finishes digging a grave despite being sweaty and filthy, showing perseverance and responsibility.
Watches the setting sun nervously, possibly indicating some uncertainty or concern affecting confidence.
Expresses gratitude and acknowledges care received, indicating interpersonal awareness but no direct relation to competence.
Keeps a little distance from the family and nervously watches the gathering darkness instead of joining the group around the fire.
Kane watches the gathering darkness nervously but does not join the family in prayer or show outward action at that moment.
Offers the protective cross to the girl, intending to keep her safe tonight.
Forces the cross onto the frightened girl, pressing the burning metal into her flesh despite her protests.
Identifies the child as a witch through his decisive and forceful use of the crucifix, revealing keen perception and willingness to act against evil.
Lunges violently at a frightened child and forces a crucifix onto her despite others' protests, causing her great pain and distress.
Warns William and family about the evil danger ahead and advises caution.
Offers practical help by consulting a map to find a safer route for the family.
Kane studies the map carefully and identifies an alternate route through the forests to avoid danger and reach their destination.
Kane warns William and the group about the evil danger gathering to the west, showing awareness and caution.
Despite his caution, Kane supports continuing forward by finding a new route instead of turning back.
Does not force his opinion aggressively when others suggest turning back or waiting, indicating measured judgment.
Reassures group by offering to lead them through dangerous territory, showing concern for their safety.
Instructs camp members not to light a fire to avoid danger and offers to take the first watch.
Insists he can lead the group safely through dangerous territory and explains his reasoning about route choices to avoid raiders.
Commands the camp to avoid lighting a fire to prevent attracting attention and volunteers for first watch, showing tactical awareness and responsibility.
Urgently wakes Samuel upon sensing danger and instructs him to warn the camp and prepare for immediate action.
Waves Samuel away to keep him silent and stay hidden from danger, showing a desire to protect him.
Stalks the marauders silently alone, taking responsibility to confront threat and protect his people.
Snaps awake instantly and responds immediately to potential threat, shows alertness and readiness.
Leaves the tent quietly and stalks through the forest to investigate potential danger alone, showing decisiveness and tactical caution.
Waves Samuel away urgently, indicating he understands the risk and need for stealth, demonstrating confident leadership and situational awareness.
Commands Samuel to return to camp and quietly wake others to prepare for immediate movement, showing strategic thinking and command ability.
Hears Samuel's cry and immediately races back through the forest, ignoring rain, thorns, and branches to come to the camp's aid.
Steps in to stop the raiders and protect the captives despite being unarmed and outnumbered.
Tries to reason with the raiders by appealing to their mercy and describing the captives as good, devout people.
Offers himself as a substitute slave to save others.
Steps forward alone to confront multiple raiders unarmed, tries to talk calmly and reason with the attacker to diffuse a dangerous situation.
Offers himself as a slave to protect others, showing presence of mind and strategic thinking under pressure.
Appears breathless and desperate, indicating some physical strain or potential vulnerability in a critical moment.
Offers no resistance and asks not to harm the innocents.
Expresses reluctance to kill and questions if that is all he is to others.
Kills Samuel by cutting his throat.
Considers taking a life but acknowledges the heavy moral cost.
Calmly offers himself without resistance to protect others, showing self-control and strategic patience.
Raises moral and philosophical objections to killing despite opportunity, showing internal conflict but maintaining control.
Dodges a sword attack and swiftly breaks opponent's arm in combat, demonstrating physical skill and decisiveness.
Almost enters a trance before transforming into a more powerful version of himself, indicating controlled internal focus and purposeful transformation.
Fights ferociously to stop raiders taking Meredith, showing determination to protect others.
Kills raiders mercilessly in combat with murderous rage.
Races back to the camp, methodically searching through bodies for information.
Dodges the blade and breaks the attacker’s arm swiftly and decisively.
Drives the sword into the man’s body with precision, effectively neutralizing the threat.
Responds effectively to multiple attackers, delivering deadly blows with each sword thrust.
Maintains composure and continuous offensive against multiple enemies, showing superior combat skill and focus.
Fails to prevent Meredith from being taken despite desperate efforts.
Chases after the raiders pursuing Meredith but loses them due to their mounted escape and the mist.
Thoroughly searches the devastated camp for information after the battle.
Takes a solemn oath to William to find his child and destroy the evil threatening them, showing commitment to a promise and protecting the innocent.
Gently takes the locket from William’s neck, checking the picture inside before turning away without visible emotional display.
Examines the raiders' corpses and uniform insignia to gather information.
Takes an oath to find the child and destroy the evil, showing resolve and commitment.
Prepares carefully for the mission by assembling weapons, provisions, and donning appropriate clothing.
Moves on without further hesitation after swearing the oath, demonstrating decisiveness.
Pursues raiders relentlessly to rescue Meredith without hesitation or personal gain.
Does not make any effort to retrieve his hat lost during the chase, showing no concern for personal appearance or comfort.
Shoots two attacking riders without any sign of remorse or hesitation.
Quickly takes control of a dead raider’s horse and pursues the fleeing riders despite difficult conditions like driving rain and poor visibility.
Maintains full control of his steed while galloping fast, ducking under branches and jumping obstacles with skill and confidence.
Waits calmly for attackers to close in and then simultaneously fires two pistols at close range, taking both attackers down without hesitation.
Does not waste time or effort on non-essential actions, such as not retrieving his hat while in pursuit.
Relentlessly chases down the raider carrying Meredith, correctly predicting their attempt to split and escape.
Runs to the young dark-haired girl to check her condition, showing concern despite her fear.
Demands the location of Meredith and beats the Raider viciously, threatening to pluck his eyes out.
Relentlessly pursues the raider despite the exhaustion of the horse, showing determination and focus.
Quickly assesses the girl dropped by the raider and realizes she is not Meredith, demonstrating observational skill and attention to detail.
Acts decisively by physically overpowering the raider and extracting information through intimidation.
Employs psychological pressure by threatening mutilation to gain information, showing strategic use of fear.
Fails to immediately secure Meredith or confirm her location despite intense interrogation, which may indicate limits in information or control but does not clearly show incompetence.
Maintains composure and vigilance even as the raider becomes possessed and dangerous, not showing panic.
Gently helps the frightened girl to sit up and reassures her she is safe.
Wraps the girl in his own cloak, showing protection and care.
Relentlessly beats the possessed Raider without hesitation.
Takes initiative to care for Elizabeth by setting up camp, cooking food, and keeping her warm and safe.
Shows uncertainty about how to comfort Elizabeth emotionally after telling her the harsh truth.
Listens attentively and gathers intelligence about the enemy from Elizabeth.
Makes a confident, quiet claim of being able to fight the seemingly overwhelming enemy force.
Leaves provisions, weapons, and supplies to Elizabeth before leaving to face danger alone.
Decides to leave Elizabeth alone despite her desperate pleas, prioritizing her safety over companionship.
Greets refugees warmly as 'friends' despite their wary silence.
Drops from his horse and personally approaches a man and his family to show a locket and ask about a missing girl.
Repeatedly urges the refugees to look at the locket and respond, even becoming frustrated ('Stop damn you! Look at it. Look!').
Checks compass at crossroads to determine direction, showing use of tools and situational awareness.
Attempts to engage and communicate with refugees to gather information regarding the girl he is searching for.
Shows frustration and insists that refugees look at the locket, attempting to elicit a response or clue despite their reluctance.
Refuses to give up despite apathy and hopelessness of refugees, demonstrating determination and resolve.
Fails to get any useful information from refugees, who are unwilling or unable to help.
Stops his horse from drinking from contaminated water and warns the animal against it.
Tries to communicate with peasants looking for a girl despite their threatening demeanor.
Draws sword and fights peasants aggressively when attacked, showing brutal efficiency.
Continuously walks on bloodied and weary despite having lost nearly everything, showing determination to persevere.
Hurries toward the church upon hearing an echoing scream, suggesting concern for others or sense of duty.
Strides on relentlessly despite being bloodied, weary, and having lost nearly everything but essential weapons and clothes
Hurries towards the church upon hearing an echoing scream, showing promptness and awareness of danger
Raises pistol at approaching attacker but stops upon seeing he is a desperate priest; lowers pistol and offers reassurance and peace.
Cautiously approaches a potentially dangerous location and holds a raised pistol ready for attack.
Whirls round at the last moment to avoid being struck and aims pistol precisely at attacker.
Recognizes attacker is actually a weak, frightened priest and de-escalates situation by lowering his weapon and speaking calmly.
Quietly acknowledges his homeland and his past without bitterness.
Harmed creatures who were once human but are now corrupted.
Shows willingness to listen to Father Michael's explanation about the cursed creatures.
Questions the priest sharply about the presence of evil and the lack of warriors fighting it, displaying frustration and anger but also concern for others' safety.
Prepares for a fight upon sensing danger, showing protective vigilance.
Expresses anger and despair over the suffering and evil in the world, indicating deep emotional engagement with others' plight.
Gets to his feet and paces angrily, questioning the priest about how to fight evil, showing frustration but also a clear desire to confront the problem.
Becomes suddenly alert upon hearing a movement and prepares himself for a fight, showing readiness and situational awareness.
Takes up a burning brand to approach the trap door after the priest reveals evil beneath the church, demonstrating courage and willingness to face danger.
Urges Father Michael to destroy the creatures for their own corrupted nature.
Shows horror and concern upon learning the creatures feed on flesh.
Attempts to maintain footing at the edge to avoid falling into danger.
Recognizes the creatures as undead ghouls and understands the danger they pose from his past travels.
Commands Father Michael to destroy the creatures, showing decisiveness and moral clarity.
Stumbles and teeters on the edge of the trap door and falls into the pit, caught by surprise.
Fights back the ghouls fiercely despite being attacked by multiple enemies in the darkness.
Fights relentlessly against ghouls to survive, using every means to protect himself.
Sets a creature on fire to create a distraction and escape, prioritizing his own survival over the creatures' suffering.
Hides from monstrous attackers, tries to escape rather than confront innocent people or flee selfishly.
Hides quietly in tunnels to avoid ghouls, masking his torch flame and listening carefully to their approach.
When cornered, he takes a breath and runs out into the open corridor despite the danger, showing willingness to face threat rather than panic.
Makes random, careless turns down junctions, losing himself in the labyrinth of tunnels, showing a moment of disorientation.
Uses a sudden gust of air to determine the correct direction to escape, demonstrating presence of mind and situational awareness.
Immediately reacts to a ghoul that steps into his path by turning and skewering it on his sword, showing quick reflexes and combat skill.
Faces five armed raiders without fear, standing resolutely against them.
Charges directly at two ghouls without hesitation, shoulders one away, carries the other with him, and successfully escapes through the exit.
Despite exhaustion, remains alert to potential threats after escaping and does not let his guard down.
Faces five heavily armed raiders without fear, standing his ground confidently despite being outnumbered.
Recognizes the raiders and their new allegiance quickly, demonstrating situational awareness.
Engages in dialogue with enemies, showing composure and intelligence when assessing their motivations.
Smiles briefly before attacking enemies to protect or avenge.
Decapitates one enemy, kills others swiftly in brutal combat.
Shows Beard a locket with a picture of Meredith, indicating a personal connection and appeal.
Allows Beard the chance to live by pushing him towards the underground tunnels despite enemies trying to seize him.
Swiftly decapitates Tattoo and kills other raiders with skill and speed, demonstrating superior combat ability.
Throws a sword to catch a fleeing enemy, successfully stopping his escape.
Uses a locket to confront Beard with evidence and offer him a choice, showing presence of mind beyond combat.
Threatens Beard to speak clearly and attempts to extract critical information aggressively.
Shows disbelief and denial upon hearing bad news, refusing to accept Beard’s report that she is dead.
Releases Beard immediately despite potential tactical advantage in keeping him restrained; Beard is then taken by ghouls and eaten alive.
Is seemingly oblivious to Beard’s screams and danger, collapsing slowly to the ground against a headstone rather than taking immediate action.
Arrives alone in a hostile town controlled by raiders under Malachi’s influence, proceeding confidently through the market despite wary locals.
Dismisses concerns about danger and refuses to hide or join resistance, showing aloofness and bluntness.
Agrees to sell horses instead of offering help or support to others in danger.
Acknowledges the Stable Master's warnings but responds with indifference and a focus on payment.
Leads horses confidently through a hostile town and interacts with the Stable Master without fear or hesitation.
Responds to suspicious questions with calm, unfaltering answers that imply strength and defiance.
Silent when directly asked if he killed the Raiders, maintaining a controlled and intimidating presence.
Dismisses warnings about spies and danger in the town, showing either confidence or possible recklessness.
Refuses to join local resistance or plan, instead prioritizing payment and personal escape (drinking himself into oblivion).
Tosses a bag of coins to the landlord to pay for ale.
Drinks himself into drunken oblivion while holding a locket of Meredith’s picture, ignoring noisy tavern crowd.
Throws a bag of coins onto the table to pay the innkeeper, ensuring his needs are met quickly and discreetly.
Drinks heavily, heading toward drunken oblivion, showing neglect of responsibilities and allowing himself to be consumed by despair.
Remains aware of surroundings and untouched by the busy, loud tavern atmosphere, demonstrating controlled focus despite personal turmoil.
Does not respond or react noticeably to Garrick and Telford approaching or confirming his identity, suggesting possible absence of vigilance or engagement at an important moment.
Ignores and dismisses old acquaintances who recognize and seek his help despite their respectful approach.
Yanks one of the men close, rejects their belief in his abilities, and calls himself 'nothing'.
Shows no hostility or aggression towards the men, despite ignoring them and being dismissive.
Peers at Telford drunkenly and initially ignores pleas for help or leadership.
Grabs Telford abruptly and denies any capability or leadership qualities, showing self-doubt.
Encourages others to fight back despite his own condition
Withdraws into despair after failing to find someone he swore to protect
Accepts harsh treatment passively without retaliating or showing anger
Does not struggle while being dragged by captors, seemingly resigned to his fate.
Does not resist or struggle when being captured and dragged out by captors, appears resigned to his fate.
Refuses to join the Overlord despite threats and hostility.
Shows no mercy or compromise towards the evil Overlord, calling him a foul servant of evil.
Ignores the suffering and screams of the townspeople during the raid and crucifixion, having 'given up' and doing nothing.
Endures brutal physical torture silently, showing stoicism but no expressed compassion or connection with others in the scene.
Endures brutal torture silently, showing resilience but no outward expression of pain or anger.
Screams upon witnessing the horrific demonic torment of innocents and himself, revealing deep empathy and emotional response to suffering.
Calls out to Meredith and focuses on her safety despite his own pain and vision of hell.
Summons all his strength to tear himself free from the cross despite immense agony, motivated to survive and presumably to act for Meredith's sake.
Summons every last drop of strength to tear his arm free from the cross despite intense agony, demonstrating determination and physical resilience.
Shouts Meredith’s name and focuses on her survival, showing focused intent and awareness despite his own dire situation.
Remains physically stunned and bleeding on the ground after freeing himself, indicating temporary vulnerability but not incompetence.
Shouts a warning to the Raiders defiantly, signaling determination to confront evil forces threatening others.
Focuses on fighting and survival without showing gratitude or acknowledgement to those who saved him (the rebel fighters).
Rejects the old woman’s offer of help, calls her pagan magic evil and a witch, and orders her to get away from him.
Firmly rejects the old woman's pagan magic and calls it evil, showing confidence and clarity in his beliefs despite the mysterious situation.
Does not answer the old woman's probing questions about crossing over or what he saw, maintaining a controlled and reserved demeanor.
Orders the old woman to keep away, showing decisiveness and self-control in a potentially confusing or threatening situation.
Interrogates the old woman about his brother, indicating focus and an intent to understand the situation despite the cryptic nature of the interaction.
Shrugs away a young fighter's help, pins Telford against the wall with a blade threateningly.
After tension and conflict, lowers his blade and relaxes, allowing cooperation.
Sits and shares bread with others, asking them to share knowledge.
Initially ignores and distances himself from others when climbing to feet.
Climbs to his feet despite being barely healed and immediately starts gathering weapons and supplies to leave the cave.
Shrugs away help from a young fighter, showing confidence and independence in his actions.
Pins Telford against the wall with a blade to the throat to assert control and make a clear decision.
After a tense standoff, he listens to allies and lowers his blade, showing prudence and openness.
Reflects internally and shows surprise that Malachi resides in his old home, hinting at some emotional distraction but also self-awareness.
Stares steadily at Merton despite seeing a demonic presence within him, then fires a pistol to stop the threat before any harm can come to others.
Fearlessly pushes swords away to protect others, reveals the truth about Merton to prevent wrongful blame.
Insists on gathering weapons and leading the men despite their doubts, motivating and encouraging them.
Labels Merton a traitor despite being their comrade, showing little tolerance for his deception.
Fearlessly pushes swords aside and rises to his feet despite being threatened at sword-point.
Identifies Merton as a traitor and reveals the branded symbol on his flesh, providing clear evidence to others.
Confidently commands the men to gather weapons and prepare to ride out immediately despite being outnumbered and the men’s hesitation.
Encourages the hesitant men by asserting he has taken cities with fewer men.
Shoots the leader of the wagon raiders to stop an attack.
Slams the cage door closed when captives beg for mercy.
Reminds McNess that the raiders were once like him.
Disguises himself as a raider to infiltrate the enemy and takes out the wagon leader efficiently by shooting him with two pistols.
Leads a coordinated surprise attack with his allies, quickly overwhelming the remaining enemies using pistols and swords.
Stops Caldicoott from freeing the captives despite their pleading, showing strategic judgment in delaying mercy to maintain control over the situation.
Encourages prisoners to find strength and promises to end their suffering.
Instructs his men to avoid unnecessary conflict to protect the group.
Leads a disguised raiding party through difficult terrain with caution and strategic intent, avoiding open battle when outmatched.
Keeps his men disciplined, instructing them to remain quiet and low to avoid detection by enemy guards.
Successfully infiltrates the castle gates without raising suspicion, despite heavy enemy presence.
Tells Caldicott to run and not fight, protecting the youth from danger.
Focuses on combating the enemy and protecting companions despite personal injury.
Kills a guard quickly to secure keys and frees prisoners from the dungeon, urging them to run free.
Freely opens all prisoner cells searching urgently to find Meredith, showing concern and willingness to help others.
Kneels to assist the old man despite his urgency, demonstrating compassion and kindness.
Offers to break the old man's chains to free him, showing empathy and desire to relieve suffering.
Is incredulous and emotional upon recognizing the old man as his father, revealing vulnerability and sincere connection.
Rummages quickly through all the cells, searching urgently and thoroughly for Meredith, showing persistence and determination.
Uses a picture locket as a means to identify and question prisoners effectively.
Observes attentively, noticing subtle signs (a cough, movement in shadows) in an apparently empty cell, demonstrating alertness and perceptiveness.
Attempts to help the old man despite physical obstacles (chains), including offering to break chains with his pistol, showing resourcefulness and initiative.
Moments of incredulity and surprise upon realizing the old man is his father, briefly halting his urgency and focus.
Reaches out a shaking hand to touch the face of his long-lost son, cradles his weak father in his arms, expresses deep shame for the death of his brother Marcus.
Tears at his chains with all his might despite no progress.
Shows emotional vulnerability and admits shame over past mistakes.
Listens carefully and learns new critical information about Marcus' fate and Malachi's sorcery.
Kills his dying father at his request to free his enslaved brother from darkness.
Confronts guards and fights his way through castle corridors, showing decisiveness and courage but no explicit concern for others here.
Follows through on the painful task of killing his own father at his request to free his brother from evil possession.
Strides confidently and undaunted down castle corridors with dead guards behind him, indicating successful combat and clear purpose.
Shows hesitation and emotional pain before shooting his father, revealing a moment of internal conflict and vulnerability.
Runs to aid his struggling comrades in battle, firing pistols and engaging enemies with blades to protect them.
Urgently orders Telford to free captives, including Meredith, showing concern and care for others’ safety.
Declares himself lord of the castle to defend claims and protect the place.
Says to brother the intent to pay for his sins, implying personal burden but no direct warmth towards others here.
Assures Marcus that he is not his enemy and identifies the true foe instead.
Advances cautiously into a dangerous place to confront evil and protect his brother.
Ready to fight but shows nervousness and restraint, not attacking rashly.
Confronts enemies despite nervousness and trembling hand on sword hilt.
Carefully follows brother into a potentially dangerous and unknown hall.
Observes surroundings carefully, noting mirrors, symbols, and demonic creatures.
When doors slam shut trapping him, remains calm and prepared with sword ready.
Calls out to Malachi rather than fleeing or panicking.
Approaches the altar nervously, waiting for an attack that does not come, showing caution but some hesitation.
Hurries to help Meredith, expresses relief and concern for her safety.
Swears to Meredith that he would come for her.
Attempts to reason with brother Marcus, pleading him to stop the attack.
Fights back defensively against brother Marcus but does not escalate aggression.
Carefully approaches a dangerous altar while readying his swords and cautiously assessing the situation.
Recognizes a surviving victim (Meredith) and moves quickly to help untie her despite the threatening environment.
Suffers a sword wound unexpectedly but instinctively blocks subsequent attacks despite pain and injury.
Attempts to reason with his attacking brother during combat, showing strategic thinking even under pressure.
Limping away under attack, temporarily disadvantaging himself but still actively defending and retreating tactically.
Fights desperately against his brother Marcus to stop the demons from escaping and protects Meredith who has freed herself and is watching in horror.
Refers to their father to warn Malachi that he has no control anymore, showing loyalty to family despite the conflict.
Focused fully on fighting and survival; no direct friendly or tolerant behavior is shown in this intense moment.
Asks forgiveness from his brother for attacking him.
Expresses horror and sorrow at his brother’s disfigured, undead state.
Pledges to lay his brother’s soul to rest by killing him to free him from curse.
Protects Meredith by fighting off attackers relentlessly.
Responds with mercy and understanding to his possessed brother Marcus by ending his suffering upon his request.
Declares 'She is my soul,' showing deep personal care and commitment to Meredith.
Lets Malachi hold Meredith hostage but demands he let her go and ultimately shoots Malachi to protect her.
Pulls Meredith to safety and tells her to trust him despite the terrifying situation.
Fires accurately at Malachi with a flintlock pistol despite high tension and danger.
Remains fearless and unwavering in front of a terrifying demon, showing confidence and calm under pressure.
Stops and lowers swords when Malachi threatens Meredith, possibly risking immediate harm.
Demonstrates quick thinking and protective instinct by pulling Meredith to safety quickly.
Commands Meredith to trust him in a grave situation despite the danger, showing leadership and self-assurance.
Folds Meredith into his arms after the danger passes, showing care and protection.
Speaks sincerely to Meredith about believing her father's words regarding redeeming his soul, revealing trust and faith.
Responds to Meredith's pleas about staying with a calm, silent demeanor and a simple apology, showing restraint and some emotional distance.
Decides to leave despite Meredith’s desire to make a home together, indicating emotional coldness or detachment in personal relationships.
Reflects on his painful past and the cause of his journey with a somber tone, suggesting inward struggle but limited outward emotional sharing.
Shares with Meredith a firm sense of purpose found through his travels, indicating sincerity though still keeping emotional distance.
Destroys the demon by causing it to shatter and vanish, demonstrating control over a supernatural threat.
Carries Meredith to safety and tends to his wounds, showing practical skill and care.
Prays at the graves of his father and brother before setting off on a journey, showing reflection and purpose.
Silently endures Meredith’s questions without explaining his departure immediately, showing emotional resolve but possibly creating misunderstanding.
Decides to leave his home despite having defeated the threat and Meredith’s insistence, showing commitment to a larger purpose beyond immediate victory.
Expresses a solemn promise to return and gently interacts with Meredith before leaving.
Pulls away gently but firmly to continue his solitary mission, leaving Meredith behind without further comfort.
Declares his mission to fight evil creatures no man could fight before, showing confidence in his unique gift and purpose.
Gently pulls away from Meredith despite emotional longing, demonstrating discipline and commitment to his duty.
Prepares carefully by readying his swords and pistols before riding off without hesitation or looking back.
